abstract: While Amazon’s razor-thin profits turned to razor-thin losses, the company’s revenue increased 22 percent.
snippet: While Amazon’s razor-thin profits turned to razor-thin losses, the company’s revenue increased 22 percent.
lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — Amazon’s razor-thin profits turned to razor-thin losses in the last quarter, as the Internet commerce giant continued to plow money into warehouses, digital content and other big investments that it says will pay off down the line.

headline.main: Amazon Reports Small Loss as It Focuses on Investments
headline.print_headline: Amazon Reports Small Loss As It Focuses on Investments
